headline: EBRD provides US$142 million for Uzbekistan’s first gigawatt-scale solar PV and energy storage portfolio
summary_80w: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has provided US$142 million in financing for the construction of a 1GW solar and 1.3GWh battery energy storage system (BESS) portfolio in Uzbekistan.

headline: Australia’s solar PV and storage sectors drive record Q3 2025 performance
summary_80w: Australia's solar and energy storage sectors delivered transformative performance during the third quarter of 2025, with grid-scale solar generation reaching 1,699MW average output while battery systems expanded capacity by 2,936MW since Q3 2024.

headline: Acen Australia commits to recycling one million modules from 400MW solar PV power plant
summary_80w: Acen Australia has committed to recycling around one million solar modules from its 400MW Stubbo solar PV power plant in New South Wales.

headline: Eku Energy, LP Renewables propose 1,600MWh Belah BESS in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Developer Eku Energy and LP Renewables have announced plans for the 400MW/1,600MWh Belah battery energy storage system in Queensland, Australia.

headline: Australia’s EPBC Act overhaul promises streamlined approvals as industry voices mixed support
summary_80w: The Australian Parliament has received the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act reform bills, marking the government's latest attempt to overhaul environmental legislation that has faced criticism for delaying renewable energy projects and contributing to biodiversity decline.

headline: RWE starts building Germany’s largest BESS
summary_80w: Power firm RWE has launched construction on a 400MW/700MWh BESS project in Bavaria, Germany, the largest being built in the country.

headline: Scatec construction revenues exceed power production revenues in Q3 2025
summary_80w: Scatec posted development and construction (D&C) revenues of NOK1,760 million (US$175.1 million) in the third quarter of this year.

headline: Global net zero ‘impossible’ by 2050, Wood Mackenzie says
summary_80w: Global net zero by 2050 is now “impossible” and the world is on course for temperature rises of 2.6°C, according to energy market analyst Wood Mackenzie.

headline: Enphase revenues rise, tariffs impact margin in Q3
summary_80w: US microinverter producer Enphase Energy posted increased revenues, margin and income in Q3 2025, as it doubles down on its US manufacturing operations.

headline: Nexamp raises US$600 million for small-scale solar and storage in the US
summary_80w: Nexamp has secured US$600 million in financing for distributed solar and energy storage projects in the US.

headline: Genesis to acquire 271MWp Waikato solar project in New Zealand
summary_80w: New Zealand’s Genesis Energy has announced plans to acquire and develop a 271MWp solar project in Waikato, on the country’s upper North Island.

headline: Meridian Energy begins construction on 120MW solar plant in New Zealand
summary_80w: Meridian Energy, a New Zealand state-owned energy company, has begun the construction of its 230GWh Ruakaka solar plant.

headline: Genera PR begins construction on 52MW BESS in Puerto Rico
summary_80w: Genera PR, the company operating the majority of Puerto Rico’s energy generation resources, has begun construction on a 52MW battery energy storage system (BESS) at the Cambalache Power Plant in Arecibo.

headline: BYD and Skysense partner to deploy 300MWh of energy storage in Latin America
summary_80w: BYD and Skysense, a Mexico-based developer of solar, storage and green hydrogen projects, announced an alliance for the implementation of 300 MWh of energy storage in Mexico and Latin America.

headline: Sungrow’s Q3 revenue, net profit and shipments soar
summary_80w: On October 29, Sungrow released its Q3 2025 report. Judging from the latest performance, whether in terms of financial data or market capitalisation, Sungrow stands 'in a league of its own'.

headline: Energy storage demand offsets EV slowdown, driving LG Energy Solution profit increase
summary_80w: Despite a slowdown in electric vehicle (EV) sales in the US, LG Energy Solution (LG ES) experienced a quarterly rise in profits, driven in part by increasing demand for energy storage.

headline: Australia: Victoria’s home battery programme delivers 20,000 installations as federal scheme takes over
summary_80w: Victoria's home battery energy storage programme has supported the installation of approximately 20,000 residential energy storage systems, doubling its original target of 10,000 units, according to the state’s climate action minister, Lily D'Ambrosio.

headline: TotalEnergies, AEW to develop 400MW As Sufun solar project in Saudi Arabia
summary_80w: French firms TotalEnergies and EDF, with local partners, secured contracts for 400MW and 600MW solar projects in Saudi Arabia, supporting Vision 2030 renewable goals.

headline: Hecate cancels 650MW Staten Island, New York BESS project
summary_80w: Hecate Energy has cancelled its 650MW Swiftsure battery energy storage system (BESS) in Staten Island, New York.

headline: EBRD co-finances ACWA Power’s 1GW/1.3GWh solar and storage portfolio in Uzbekistan
summary_80w: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has provided US$142 million in financing for the construction of a 1GW solar and 1.3GWh BESS portfolio in Uzbekistan.

headline: Historically ‘benign’ solar markets for climate risk must adapt to intensifying extreme weather conditions
summary_80w: Damage to solar from so-called Natural Catastrophe events is increasing as the technology expands its reach and weather conditions worsen.

headline: SOLAR-PLUS-STORAGE ROUND-UP: Greenvolt secures finance, European Energy divests Latvian project
summary_80w: Greenvolt and European Energy have finalised financial deals for solar-plus-storage projects in Denmark and Latvia.

headline: NextEra adds 3GW of renewable generation to backlog in Q3
summary_80w: NextEra Energy Resources added 3GW of new renewable energy generation and storage capacity to its portfolio in the third quarter of 2025.

headline: Corning brings online wafer plant in Q3, targets daily wafer production of one million
summary_80w: US solar manufacturer Corning has brought online its wafer production at its Michigan plant, during the third quarter of 2025.

headline: Propwr secures contract for natural gas BESS hybrid with Midwest US data centre
summary_80w: Propwr, a division of ProPetro, has secured a long-term power supply contract to commit 60MW of energy to support a hyperscaler data centre operator in the Midwest region of the US.

headline: Argentina’s first BESS tender to inform future auctions, says CAMMESA
summary_80w: CAMMESA spoke at Energy Storage Latin America 2025 about Argentina's latest standalone tender and what to expect in the future.

headline: Greenvolt, European Energy, Olana and Energix progress Denmark, Poland and Baltic BESS projects
summary_80w: IPPs Greenvolt and European Energy have finalised financial deals for solar-plus-storage projects in Denmark and Latvia, while Olana and Energix have enlisted optimisers for BESS projects in Lithuania and Poland, respectively.

headline: SMA system integrator subsidiary Altenso enters Australian market with two BESS projects
summary_80w: German solar inverter manufacturer SMA has officially launched its system integrator subsidiary in Australia, with work underway on two battery storage projects.

headline: Daiwa Energy & Infrastructure builds 160MWh revenue-stacking BESS in Hokkaido, Japan
summary_80w: Daiwa Energy & Infrastructure (DEI), an asset manager backed by investment bank Daiwa Securities, has invested in a large-scale battery storage project in northern Japan.

headline: Australia’s energy transition ‘not a pipe dream,’ says new Clean Energy Council CEO
summary_80w: "The energy transition is not a pipe dream. It's here and it's happening right now," declared Jackie Trad, the newly appointed CEO of the Clean Energy Council, at the start of All-Energy Australia 2025 in Melbourne this morning (29 October).

headline: Singapore: 670MW ‘hydrogen-ready’ CCGT with integrated battery storage, inertia trial at Southeast Asia’s biggest BESS
summary_80w: Singapore’s Jurong Island looks set to host a combined cycle gas turbine (CCGT) power plant with integrated battery storage.

headline: GreenYellow to invest US$116 million in C&I solar-plus-storage in Poland
summary_80w: GreenYellow plans to invest US$116 million in Poland over the next three years to expand its installed capacity and customer base.

headline: ‘Everyone is talking about’ co-located solar and storage PPA in Europe
summary_80w: BESS are 'the new player that everyone is talking about,' in Europe’s power purchase agreement (PPA) space, according to LevelTen.

headline: GoldenPeaks Capital secures US$132 million financing for Polish PV portfolio
summary_80w: GoldenPeaks Capital secures EUR114 million (US$132 million) financing package for two solar PV Portfolio in Poland.

headline: Navigating shifting module costs and falling power prices at PV ModuleTech Europe 2025
summary_80w: Navigating module procurement in this financial environment will be a key topic of conversation at the PV ModuleTech Europe 2025 event.

headline: Best practices for choosing a PV consultant and data provider
summary_80w: PV projects operate close to technical and financial limits, meaning that inaccurate inputs can have performance and profitability impacts.

headline: GoodWe launches C&I string inverter for European market
summary_80w: Chinese solar inverter producer GoodWe has launched a new “low noise, low weight” string inverter for the European corporate & industrial solar market.

headline: FRV Australia commits to 210MWdc New Zealand solar PV plant after Genesis partnership ends
summary_80w: Fotowatio Renewable Ventures (FRV) Australia has announced the development of a 210MWdc solar project in New Zealand's Rangitikei District.

headline: Tesla reports record energy storage deployments and profit ahead of vote on Musk’s monster pay proposal
summary_80w: Tesla reported record energy storage deployments and business segment profits in Q3 2025, just ahead of a shareholder vote on CEO Elon Musk’s historic remuneration package.

headline: Zinc battery storage startup Eos to invest US$353 million in manufacturing and HQ move to Pennsylvania
summary_80w: Eos announced its move to Pennsylvania, US, as well as agreements for energy storage projects with Talen Energy and MN8 Energy.

headline: Driving change: Volvo Penta’s battery systems for BESS applications in construction
summary_80w: Industrial power solutions manufacturer Volvo Penta discusses its battery systems for BESS with a focus on the heavy industry and construction sectors.

headline: ‘Terna is the big winner’: Taking stock of Italy’s MACSE auction
summary_80w: We gather the industry reaction to the MACSE auction in Italy, which saw TSO Terna procure 10GWh of long-term capacity at what most agreed are extremely low prices.

headline: Australia: Energy storage comprises 26.1GW of AEMO’s record 56.6GW NEM project pipeline

headline: Wärtsilä to deliver ‘Australia’s largest DC-coupled hybrid battery system’ for the NEM

headline: Shanghai Electric to build 342MW solar PV in Romania

headline: Meta, Engie ink 600MW solar PV PPA in Texas
summary_80w: Engie has signed additional PPAs with Meta, expanding their partnership to more than 1.3GW across four solar projects in Texas.

headline: Waaree lands 692MW solar module deals across India and the US
summary_80w: Waaree Energies has secured four solar module supply contracts totalling 692MW – three for projects in India and one in the US through its subsidiary.

headline: BNRG Leeson advances 440MWdc solar-plus-storage project in Victoria, Australia

headline: Daqo polysilicon sales jump, company claims ‘healthy’ inventory level in Q3 2025
summary_80w: Chinese polysilicon producer Daqo New Energy saw an increase in sales and profits in Q3 2025, as the sector looks to address ongoing oversupply and financial losses.

headline: Solar corporate funding sees uptick in Q3 2025 with US$6.5 billion

headline: Premier Energies strengthens solar portfolio with KSolare, Transcon buy

headline: Saft wins 356MWh battery storage project contract in Taiwan with Foxlink Group company

headline: ‘Significantly more complex than expected’: Redearth’s Australian vehicle-to-grid launch

summary_80w: The Emirati state-owned renewables developer Masdar has begun construction on a giant solar-plus-storage project in Abu Dhabi.

headline: Energy Vault, Jupiter Power, advance projects in ERCOT BESS market

headline: US battery materials and BESS firm Redwood raises US$350 million Series E
summary_80w: Redwood Materials has closed a US$350 million Series E funding round to scale up its critical battery materials and energy storage businesses.

headline: California utility renegotiates purchase agreement with RWE for 476MWh BESS after regulator rejects initial proposal
summary_80w: San Diego Gas & Electric (SDG&E) is seeking regulatory approval to acquire an operational portion of a BESS facility located in Imperial County, California, from the US development arm of German multinational energy company RWE.

headline: Price falls have enabled ‘zero-capex’ co-located BESS business model in Spain, company says

headline: South Korean government investment in US BESS developer ‘reflects shared commitment to reliable, affordable power’
summary_80w: Peregrine Energy Solutions has secured US$130 million from investors including the South Korean Ministry of Environment.

headline: VIDEO: Demystifying the BESS metrics that matter most, from SoC and SoH to cell imbalance and RTE
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Wärtsilä, demystifying the BESS metrics that matter most.

headline: Samsung C&T proposes 200MW grid-scale battery storage system in Queensland, Australia

headline: T1 Energy sold 725MW of modules in Q3 2025, predicts ‘significant increase’ in Q4
summary_80w: US solar manufacturer T1 Energy sold approximately 725MW of solar modules in Q3 2025, as it continues to expand US manufacturing capabilities.

headline: Powerlink Queensland seeks federal tick for substation to connect 775MW solar PV plant
summary_80w: Powerlink Queensland is seeking federal approval to expand its existing 330kV Bulli Creek Substation in Southern Queensland to accommodate the grid connection of Genex Power's 775MW Bulli Creek solar PV power plant.

headline: European solar PPA prices fall below €35/MWh in Q3 2025
summary_80w: The average price of a solar PPA signed in Europe in Q3 2025 fell below €35/MWh, reaching €34.25/MWh, according to LevelTen Energy.

headline: Nuveen Infrastructure closes US$171 million financing for 137MW South Korean PV plant
summary_80w: Infrastructure investment firm Nuveen Infrastructure has secured US$171 million in financing for a 137MW solar PV plant in South Korea.

headline: A giant on the rooftop: Tongwei’s TNC 2.0 modules take centrestage at All Energy Australia
summary_80w: Tongwei's rooftop-focused TNC 2.0 G12R-48 module will be among the products on show at All Energy Australia next week.

headline: Solar PV retains most competitive LCOE globally in 2025 – Wood Mackenzie
summary_80w: Solar PV technology has maintained its leading position as the most cost-competitive power generation source in 2025, according to analyst Wood Mackenzie.

headline: Aviva, Astatine partner on US$928 million European industrial clean energy programme
summary_80w: Aviva Investors and Astatine have announced an €800 million (US$928 million) investment in renewable energy and decarbonisation solutions.

headline: Ingeteam inks 100MW solar-plus-storage project supply contract with European Energy Australia

headline: Australia: Queensland rooftop solar surpasses 5GW output milestone for the first time

headline: Raffeisen pension fund joins EBRD, EU on large-scale Croatia BESS and VPP investment
summary_80w: A pension fund will join the EBRD and EU Modernisation Fund in investing around €16 million (US$18.5 million) in a project on Croatia pairing large-scale BESS and a VPP.

headline: California BESS legislation update: Fire safety bill becomes law, permitting restrictions do not
summary_80w: With the final deadline for this year’s California legislative session having passed, now is a good time to analyse the outcomes of several bills that were first introduced earlier this year pertaining to BESS.

headline: CATL’s Q3 ESS battery shipments reach 36GWh, market share ‘impacted by capacity constraints’
summary_80w: The world's largest lithium-ion company CATL has released its Q3 results, with revenue growth recovering from the previous period but its market share 'somewhat impacted by capacity constraints', a company executive said.

headline: Philippines ‘entering an era where energy storage is indispensable’, says solar pioneer

summary_80w: ARENA has committed AU$25 million to support startup Relectrify's world-first ‘inverterless’ battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: ‘Developers don’t want geopolitical risks’: Fluence talks up US domestic content strategy
summary_80w: John Zahurancik, Americas president at Fluence, discussed industry trends and policy directions with ESN Premium at this year’s RE+.

headline: South Australia launches first capacity tender for 700MW of long-duration energy storage
summary_80w: South Australia has officially opened its inaugural Firm Energy Reliability Mechanism (FERM) tender round, seeking up to 700MW of long-duration energy storage (LDES) capacity to enhance grid reliability and support the state's renewable energy transition.

headline: US FINANCING ROUND-UP: Recurrent, Ampliform and Dimension secure finance for PV projects
summary_80w: Recurrent Energy, Ampliform and Dimension Energy have announced new financing rounds this month for US solar projects.

headline: Why LONGi’s back contact technology prioritises long-term value over short-term competition
summary_80w: LONGi vice president Dennis She discusses the value logic behind the company's strategic focus on back contact technology.

headline: Leeward starts operations at 177MW Tennessee solar project

headline: Apple, Engie ink 88MW agriPV PPA in Italy
summary_80w: Utility giant Engie has signed a 15-year renewable energy power purchase agreement (PPA) with tech giant Apple in Italy.

headline: First Solar 45X tax credit deals pass US$2 billion with latest transfer
summary_80w: US thin-film manufacturer First has revealed another transfer of its 45X manufacturing tax credits in a deal worth around US$775 million.

headline: SEIA CEO, Abigail Ross Hopper, to step down in January 2026
summary_80w: Abigail Ross Hopper, the president and CEO of US trade association the Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA), has decided to step down from her roles at the end of January 2026.

headline: ‘A much stronger focus on storage integration’

headline: Australia: Queensland councils receive new toolkit for navigating renewable energy project assessments
summary_80w: The Queensland government has launched the Social Licence in Renewable Energy Toolkit, providing local councils in Australia with resources to navigate renewable energy project engagement and community consultation processes.

headline: US battery storage financing ‘has become more challenging’

headline: US thermal energy storage startup Rondo deploys 100MWh industrial ‘Heat Battery’

headline: Trinasolar to supply Mestron Energy with 50MW of Vertex N solar modules

headline: Energy Storage Awards 2025: Shortlists revealed for celebration of industry’s best and brightest
